bibl.title: Letter from Raymond O. Dart to Philip Showalter Hench, May 4, 1948

div1.p: Dart sends Hench a copy of the exhibit folder and tentative program of the International Congress of Tropical Medicine.

div1.head: Letter from Raymond O. Dart to Philip Showalter Hench, May 4, 1948
div1.opener:
MEDEM OO1.2
DEPARTMENT OF PATHOLOGY
AMERICAN REGISTRY OF PATHOLOGY
ARMY INSTITUTE OF PATHOLOGY
7TH STREET AND INDEPENDENCE AVENUE SW
WASHINGTON 25, D. C.
4 May 1948
RAS/mdm
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM
ARMY MEDICAL ILLUSTRATION SERVICE
Philip S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p: Thank you for your letter of 29 April 1948.

Inclosed are one (1) copy each of the Exhibit Folder and the
Tentative Program of the Fourth International Congress of Tropical Medicine
and Malaria.

Upon your arrival in Washington, around 11:00 A.M. on Tuesday,
11 May, may I suggest that you call Captain Archie Low, MSC, Supply Officer,
Army Institute of Pathology, on REpublic 6700, ext. 2804. Captain Low has
been instructed to supply transportation from the train to the Exhibit Space,
which is indicated on the accompanying Folder.

If your plans should include other arrangements for transpor-
tation from the station, Doctor George W. Bachman, Hall of Nations,
Washington Hotel, 15th and Pennsylvania Avenue N.W., will be supervising
the exhibits on Tuesday the 11th, and he will be able to give you the
necessary assistance. The telephone number at the Washington Hotel is
Metropolitan 5900.

Plans are progressing favorably at this end. The background
for the Exhibit has been constructed and the locked-type, aluminum cases
that are to contain your material are in readiness for transportation to
the Exhibit Space.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, RAYMOND O. DART
Brigadier General, USA
Director 2 Incls
1 - Tentative Program
4th ICTMM
2 - Information Exhibit Folder
